org.twdata.kokua.script.flow
Interface ContinuationsManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContinuationsManagerImpl
public interface ContinuationsManager

The interface of the Continuations manager. The continuation manager maintains a forrest of Continuation trees. Each tree defines the flow of control for a user within the application. A Continuation is created for a continuation object from the scripting language used. A continuation object in the implementation of the scripting language is an opaque object here. It is only stored inside the Continuation, without being interpreted in any way.

Since:
March 19, 2002
Version:
CVS $Id: ContinuationsManager.java,v 1.1 2004/01/04 01:53:58 mrdon Exp $
Author:

Method Detail

createContinuation

Continuation createContinuation(java.lang.Object kont)
Create a Continuation object given a native continuation object and its parent. If the parent continuation is null, the Continuation returned becomes the root of a tree in the forrest.

Parameters:
kont - an Object value
Returns:
a Continuation value
See Also:
Continuation

removeContinuation

void removeContinuation(Continuation k)
Invalidates a Continuation. This effectively means that the continuation object associated with it will no longer be accessible from Web pages. Invalidating a Continuation invalidates all the Continuations which are children of it.

Parameters:
k - a Continuation value

lookupContinuation

Continuation lookupContinuation(java.lang.String id)
Given a Continuation id, retrieve the associated Continuation object.

Parameters:
id - a String value
Returns:
a Continuation object, or null if no such Continuation could be found.

getAllContinuations

java.util.Collection getAllContinuations()
Prints debug information about all web continuations into the log file.

See Also:
Continuation#display()
